notes: First generation A3 (8L, 1996–2003). Not officially sold in US during this period. Compact hatchback based on Golf platform. Diesel models available in Europe. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi A3 article, January 2025 revision.
Fifth generation A4 (B5, 1994–2001). First A4 generation sold in US. quattro AWD available on 2.8L models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi A4 article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation A6 (C4, 1994–1997). Renamed from Audi 100. quattro AWD available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi A6 article, January 2025 revision.
Third generation A6 (C5, 1997–2004). Available twin-turbo 2.7L V6. quattro AWD available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi A6 article, January 2025 revision.

First generation A8 (D2, 1994–2002). First production car with aluminum space frame construction. W12 engine added in 2001. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi A8 article, January 2025 revision.
First generation TT (8N, 1998–2006). Iconic coupe design. FWD on base models, quattro AWD on higher-output models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi TT article, January 2025 revision.
B4 generation Cabriolet (1991–2000). Based on B3/B4 80/90 platform. FWD only in US market. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi Cabriolet article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation S4 (C4, 1991–1994). Performance variant of 100/A6. Inline-five turbo or V8. quattro AWD standard. Not officially sold in US. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi S4 article, January 2025 revision.
Fifth generation S4 (B5, 1997–2002). Performance variant of A4. Twin-turbo V6. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi S4 article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation S6 (C4, 1994–1997). Performance variant of A6. Inline-five turbo or V8. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi S6 article, January 2025 revision.
Third generation S6 (C5, 1999–2003). Performance variant of A6. V8 engine. quattro AWD standard. Not officially sold in US. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi S6 article, January 2025 revision.
First generation S8 (D2, 1996–2002). Performance variant of A8. V8 engine. quattro AWD standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi S8 article, January 2025 revision.
First generation TT with quattro AWD (8N, 1999–2006). Higher-output 1.8T with AWD. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi TT article, January 2025 revision.

Fifth generation RS4 (B5, 1999–2001). High-performance variant of A4 Avant. Twin-turbo V6. quattro AWD standard. Wagon only. Not officially sold in US. Data sourced from Wikipedia Audi RS4 article, January 2025 revision.
